title: Riot Pls: Dev priorities and the League client

I pledge fealty to you, my memelord.

rito sense of humor is just on point today lol

He doesn't want people to think he's a hipster so he's super lowkey about his vaping habit. But if you saw his collection you'd be hella jelly: his most prized pen has four built-in heat settings and the battery is mad fresh like 100 full heat cycles between recharges. 

Graves don't play

Yeah that's rly great
Can we get the 5 bans per team in ranked already please?!
what about 10 bans for each team that would be super good and fair

50 bans for each team

yorick would become meta
SHhhhhh! Then the masses will know the glory that is Jungle{{champion:83}}

So here's a question I have: Why is everyone so irritated Soloqueue is gone now? like, my roommates up at Gold and I actually rather LIKE Dynamic Queue better, or am I missing something? Is it just whining and moaning that Riot removed something, and people are acting like, for the first time ever, Rito's going to go back on something they've done because people whine enough about it?

Why do peoplelike Solo Queue better than Dynamic Queue? there's nothing better about SQ

The primary reason people are complaining is because they think premades have an unfair advantage if they're on voice chat. And they probably do, although the advantage is slight.

IMHO the solution isn't to keep people from playing with their friends (aka trading Dynamic Queue for Solo Queue). It's to give solo players more communication tools so the advantage premades might have is minimized or eliminated. 

That means we're sure as shit gonna have to make ship some new features

LOL just no, Cactopus. People are not just complaining about the premades, they are complaining about how it is ruining the experience for them to climb in ranked and get better as a solo player. The advantage for premades is more than just "slight," it's ALOT. They also are complaining more and more as they hear the bullcrap reasons why you won't bring SoloQ back. Also, I don't want to hear your numbers about the majority of players "like" DQ and what not, as those numbers can be easily questioned in their clarity. The majority of players DO NOT LIKE dynamic queue and want it out of League.

EDIT: And all of you downvoting me should be ashamed of yourself.

No disrespect SnugglePuggle94, but like we're pretty much moving past the "most people don't like it" argument at this point. It's just not true—it's a small but vocal (and very passionate) minority that's super upset about dynamic queue. Lots of people always wanted the ability to play ranked with more than one friend, and lots of people are fine with DQ now. The upset vocal minority has some *very legitimate* complaints about dynamic queue, so we're gonna bust our asses to try to address those criticisms and make ranked better for everyone. That means new features, more communication tools, better matchmaking tuning, and on. That's where we're going now. Again, this isn't to say that we're ignoring the criticisms of dynamic queue. We hear you. And we're gonna get creative to make things better for all players. 

Hold my hand SnugglePuggle94. Together we're gonna go on a magical journey
Cactopus, you are amazing.
I bet you're exceptionally good looking and are a master at hula-hooping
youre my favorite rioter ever will you be my friend LOL

Add me, friend! SN: CACTOPUS

Warning: I'm Silver 3 and am currently working to git gud

> LOL just no, Cactopus. People are not just complaining about the premades, they are complaining about how it is ruining the experience for them to climb in ranked and get better as a solo player.

Isnt that just complaining about the premades
yep

Talk about a prideful child. Solo wasn't amazingly better than DQ. I played Solo Q for 4 years. I think DQ is fine, Although I don't play with anybody during ranked, The "slight" advantage is not crazy high or anything. You can easily overcome it. And the emblems are more for players to see who had teammates boost them to higher elos or if those players climbed themselves, It is a step in the right direction, and they said its the first of many. I'm sorry that your Bronze 1 self has such a hard time.  Git Gud.{{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}

Please don't be rude to SnugglePuggle because of their rank! I was bronze until super recently—this year I even competed in the bronzer tier finals of Riot's semiannual League tournament. We're all at different stages of our inevitable ascent to challenjour  {{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}

Excuse me? Do not attack people using their rank. That's mean. Downvoted.

Again, emblems will let premades be able to see who is solo and therefore abuse them even more, making solo experience even worse. It's not a step in the right direction at all.

I don't care about your rank. I've been there. But you're attacking riot without any info to back what you're saying that most players hate DQ, Most players don't hate DQ. And It is a step in the right direction, One reason a few people dislike the DQ is because people can Climb the ladder easier with playing in a premade, That being said, Giving players emblems. You will know what players earned their rank by climbing alone or climbed by being in a 5 man group. And no Emblems will not let players "know who is solo". Them emblem is factoring your past 25 games and how often you were grouped to not grouped. Just because a player has the solo emblem does not mean that player is alone every game. The emblem will not make your game turn into a gangbang on the solo players. And you do not fight premades that often. Don't say it happens 1/10 games or anything. Unless the player is around Diamond+ its a very rare occasion. Premades fight other premades 99% of the time. The main reason I brought up your rank is because it does not make sense that you;re so frustrated with Premades if you never fight them. I'm looking for a link to the article about premades fighting premades**couldn't find the main article but here, http://na.leagueoflegends.com/na/site/2016-season-update/ranked-improvements.html, at the start of the season was 95% and has gotten to around 98%. Riot is a good company, I agree DQ has its problems but your anger does not match what you play. DQ is better than Solo Q as a whole.

I've found my info from all the boards posts. Most people I see hate DQ. On one hand Cactopus said on a thread last week that in the survey results "most people enjoy DQ" but I don't think the results have much clarity. To me I think most people who said they like it during the time of survey didn't see all the downsides when the premade factors started rolling in. It can be a number of things but DQ has been hated or disliked for the majority of posts I've seen.

I have been playing with lots of premades. Even today I've had some duos on my team, who played awful. But I've had many games where I've been stomped by fucking 3+ premades, and camped ridiculously hard by them. 

And yes, the emblem will let premades see that a solo player is solo. They will attack that person harder because they know they are a solo player and can take advantage of it. Not all of them will do, but most premades have that intention. So yes, I have the frustration of premades in my rank. I fucking lost my s5 promos to them. 

And no, DQ is not better at all. I climbed better in SQ. I was able to have more fun in SQ. Everything was better in SQ compared to this bullshit of a system.

One of the sole reasons I don't use the boards anymore. It has become a circlejerk of people complaining about DQ. Check the subreddit for   more information. https://www.reddit.com/r/leagueoflegends/comments/44cb2w/the_circlejerk_on_solo_queue_vs_dynamic_queue_is/. The boards isn't horrible , but it has just become a place for memes and people complaining. Everything you post in boards gets downvoted whether its a champion idea, Saying you accomplished something, or upvoted if you say something is broken.
I know that. I'm constantly getting downvotes. But I won't let that stop me from saying what's on my mind.

Hey Snuggle I'm sorry our talk turned into such a shitstorm of downvotes. I really just wanted to engage in conversation and I respect your opinion. Add me as a friend and we can chill in-game sometime

Are you considering an expanded ping / in-game communication system to allow players to communicate more concepts without having to type (or speak)?

For example, being able to quickly indicate "let's set up a trap here" / "let's gank here" / "assassin please flank from here", etc.?
Yes.
Please give the team my thanks on that front.
Tomorrow I'm gonna wait until each of them is least prepared for a high five and then i'll give them a high five

Solo queue weeaboo walking in here, I have to disagree with this a bit. See, solo queing in dynamic queue is absolutely the pits, not just because of communication (although a built in Dota esque voice system could be cool) but because of friends. Don't get me wrong friends are cool too. But going from the same principle as the honor system, as said in its post, its easy to be nice to friends. Ergo honors from people on your friends list mean like nada. The same logic applies here, when you solo you usually end up with a team of four friends, (and thanks to the new system I congratulate you on) against a team of four friends and another solo. Now, I propose this. If that team of four carries, and play together all the time, they will do well. If the team of four on your side don't, they will not. And worst of all you end up in the middle of it. So they won't really listen to you and the enemy team just bulldozes your nexus. Anyone can work well with good friends. But if you don't have any, you have to rely on your own power and attempts to reach out to them to get anything done. The point is this: as the system stands, it enforces a "Bring friends or go home." sort of issue. I want to be able to play alone and not have to worry about their entire team deathbushing the whole map because no one will listen to me or ward, and their team is on point with it. When you play with people you know, VoIP isn't always necessary, because you know how the support thresh, for example, will always flay them into you and ult if he lands a hook. If I solo adc, I don't know anything about that thresh. And if I manage to climb and do well in spite of that, that should mean something. Now, I do respect the badge system for displaying this, and I appreciate the effort Riot puts out to its toxic players XD. I just wanted to bring another perspective as I continue to weep and mourn solo queue.

1. 5 single players vs a 3,4, or 5-man premade leaves the 5 solo   players at a huge disadvantage. The premade is coming into the game with knowledge of their teammates, playstyle, champ pool, stuff like that and can build around it to make a more effective team comp and such. On top of that, the premade will have more cooperation, coordination, and often times a voice chat set up so that they can relay information quicker, more precisely, and without the risk of getting attacked while typing. 

2. Premades make it much easier to boost your friends thus drastically unbalancing ranks and matchmaking. For instance, my brother and his friends boosted somebody who was fresh 30 and new from bronze 5 who had a 32% winrate in bronze to gold by playing as a 5 man group and carrying him.

3. This is a personal gripe with Dynamic queue however I cant be the only person this happens to. When I end up on the same team as a 3 or 4 man premade, I am consistently forced to deal with being ignored or flat out screwed over by the premade. In Mid lane, especially when the premade has the same clan tag, the other team will notice if only one person does not have the same name as the rest of the group, I check for this every game as well so that we can take advantage of it, and leads to constant camping while the premade jungler only ganks for the premade. However it is much worse as a Jungler. I have had issues ranging from the premade refusing to leash for me to taking smite themselves and stealing my buffs at level 1 and 2 leaving me very far behind.
